intro: Tschudya asperiuscula, commonly known as the rough tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Tschudya asperiuscula is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
